attributes.action: Introduce legislation to regulate fees charged by Administrators
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The administration industry is rife with dodgy practices and administrators just walk over everyone, suppliers, shareholders for their own greedy gains. 
For example, i have read today that Deloitte has acted as administrator for three of the biggest household name casualties : Woolworths, Waterford Wedgwood and Land of Leather.  

Insolvency partners working on Woolworths charged an hourly rate of up to £890. 
Since Woolworths collapsed in November 2008, Deloitte has been paid almost £5.8m in fees. Secured creditors, such as the banks, have received £325m, but their unsecured counterparts have been less fortunate. They are getting zero, zilch, nada.

 
WOOLWORTHS 
Collapsed: November 2008 
Job losses: 30,000 
Adminstrator: Deloitte 
Fees paid: £5.77m
Please vote to regulate the fees in this unscrupulous industry
